elements.title: man with Down syndrome who has lifted 425 pounds (193 kg) (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2024 inductees to the Delaware Sports Museum and Hall of Fame include a man with Down syndrome who has lifted 425 pounds (193 kg) (pictured), an "average gymnast" turned Olympics judge, a "preeminent sportswriter", the state's "greatest high hurdler", the "inventor" of the modern sports mascot, a record-setting 10-year-old, a champion gymnast, an Olympic field hockey player, and a pro baseball player in five countries?

elements.title: an ancient Chinese village (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that an ancient Chinese village likely had its own local pyromancer?

elements.title: James White (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Napoleon awarded a medal to English inventor James White?

elements.title: nozawana (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Japanese vegetable nozawana got its name from skiers visiting Nozawaonsen who were impressed by the area's pickled turnip?

elements.title: opposed the idea of extraterrestrial life (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Plato and Aristotle both opposed the idea of extraterrestrial life?

elements.title: Levi Marhabi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that by 2022 Levi Marhabi had become the last known Jew in Yemen?

elements.title: How Long (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the inclusion of the Canadian song "How Long" in a bootleg Russian DVD resulted in a sixteen-year search for the track's creator?

elements.title: a species of Brazilian cichlid (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a species of Brazilian cichlid is named after both Satan and Lilith?

elements.title: their radio show (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Beatles secretly called the host of their radio show "Pee Litres"?
